alert.note: Alert for Antelope Valley; Los Angeles County Mountains excluding the Santa Monica Range; Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued December 29 at 1:55PM PST until December 30 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM PST THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE LAKE, BOBCAT, DAM, AND RANCH 2 BURN SCARS IN LOS ANGELES COUNTY... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall are possible. * WHERE...The following recent burn areas of Los Angeles County, the Lake burn area near Lake Hughes, and the Bobcat, Dam, and Ranch 2 burns in the eastern San Gabriel Mountains and foothills. * WHEN...From 6 PM PST this evening through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall could trigger flash flooding and debris flows in and around these recent burn scars. Roads may be impacted or closed and vehicles may be stranded. Localized damage to structures is possible. Residents near these burn scars should prepare for potential flash flooding and debris flow impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information and orders from local authorities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A narrow band with several hours of moderate to heavy rain may form over these burn areas, which could lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flash Flood Watch means that conditions may develop that lead to flash flooding. Flash flooding is a VERY DANGEROUS SITUATION.

area.areaDesc: Antelope Valley; Los Angeles County Mountains excluding the Santa Monica Range; Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley
